Orcs class¶

class orcs.orcs.Orcs(option_file_path, spectrum_cube_path=None, **kwargs)¶

Bases: orb.core.Tools

ORCS user-interface.

Manage the option file and the file system. This is the equivalent in ORCS of orbs.Orbs() for ORBS.

Most of the keywords used by ORBS are also used by ORCS. In general it is easier to include the option file used for the reduction of the data (using the keyword ‘INCLUDE’ followed by the path to the option file to include) and set the options which are special to ORCS. e.g.:

INCLUDE /path/to/orbs.opt # include the ORBS option file

CUBEPATH /path/to/CALIBRATED_SPECTRUM # Path to the spectrum cube (hdf5 format)
LINES [NII]6548,Halpha,[NII]6583,[SII]6716,[SII]6731 # Lines to extract
OBJECT_VELOCITY 170 # in km.s-1, mean velocity of the object
POLY_ORDER 0 # Order of the polynomial used to fit continuum

ORCS keywords (for the other keywords see orbs.orbs.Orbs):

INCLUDE:Include another option file. Note that the already existing keywords will be overriden. This keyword is thus best placed at the very beginning of a file. All the keywords (but the ‘protected ones’) contained it the included file can be overriden by setting the same keyword after the include (see orb.core.OptionFile).
CUBEPATH:Path to the spectrum cube (hdf5 format)
LINES:Wavelength (in nm) of the lines to extract separated by a comma. Their full name can also be given but it must respect the list of recorded lines by orb.core.Lines. A line wavelentgh in nm can also be given.
OBJECT_VELOCITY:
 (Optional) Mean velocity of the observed object in km.s-1. This is used to guess the mean shift of the lines.
POLY_ORDER:(Optional) Order of the polynomial used to fit continuum. Be extremely careful with high order polynomials.
ROI:(Optional) Region of interest Xmin,Xmax,Ymin,Ymax (in pixels). Must be intergers separated by a comma, e.g.: 175,250,165,245
SKY_REG:(Optional) Path to a ds9 region file defining the sky pixels.
CALIBMAP:(Optional) Path to the calibration laser map. Must be given if the cube has not been wavelength calibrated.

See also

orbs.orbs.Orbs

See also

orb.core.OptionFile

__init__(option_file_path, spectrum_cube_path=None, **kwargs)¶

Init Orcs class.

Parameters:
  • option_file_path – Path to the option file.
  • spectral_cube_path – (Optional) Path to the spectral cube. If None, CUBEPATH keyword must be set in the option file.
  • kwargs – Kwargs are core.Tools() properties.

Extract integrated spectra.

Extract and fit the integrated spectrum of a given region.

Parameters:
  • x – X position of the region
  • y – Y position of the region
  • r – radius of the region
  • plot – (Optional) If True, plot the spectrum and its fit (default True).

map_sky_velocity(div_nb=15, plot=True)¶

Map the sky velocity on rectangular grid and interpolate it to return a map of the velocity zero point that can be subtracted to the returned velocity map of the cube fit.

Parameters:
  • div_nb – (Optional) Number of division on one axis of the rectangular grid. The total number of points is div_nb^2 (default 15).
  • plot – (Optional) If True, plot the result (default True)

SpectralCube class¶

class orcs.orcs.SpectralCube(cube_path, project_header=[], wcs_header=[], calibration_laser_header=[], overwrite=False, indexer=None, silent_init=False, binning=None, **kwargs)¶

Bases: orb.core.HDFCube

ORCS spectral cube processing class.

Fit and/or extract spectra.

_add_wcs_header(hdr)¶

Add WCS header keywords to a header.

Parameters:hdr – Header to update
_extract_spectrum_from_region(region, calibration_coeff_map, wavenumber, step, order, subtract_spectrum=None, median=False, silent=False)¶

Extract the mean spectrum from a region of the cube.

Parameters:
  • region – A list of the indices of the pixels integrated in the returned spectrum.
  • calibration_coeff_map – Map of the calibration coefficient (calibration laser map / calibration laser wavelength). If the cube is wavelength calibrated this map must be a map of ones.
  • wavenumber – If True cube is in wavenumber, else it is in wavelength.
  • step – Step size in nm
  • order – Folding order
  • median – If True the integrated spectrum is the median of the spectra. Else the integrated spectrum is the mean of the spectra (Default False).
  • silent – (Optional) If True, nothing is printed (default False).
Subtract_spectrum:
 

Remove the given spectrum from the extracted spectrum before fitting parameters. Useful to remove sky spectrum. Both spectra must have the same size.
Returns:

A scipy.UnivariateSpline object.
_fit_lines_in_cube(region, lines, step, order, fwhm_guess, wavenumber, calibration_coeff_map, calibration_laser_map, nm_laser, poly_order, filter_range, shift_guess, fix_fwhm=False, fmodel='gaussian', subtract=None, cov_pos=True, cov_sigma=True, cov_fwhm=True, binning=1, apodization=None, velocity_range=None)¶

Fit lines in a spectral cube.

Parameters:
  • region – A list of the indices of the pixels to extract.
  • lines – searched lines. Must be given in the unit of the cube (cm-1 if wavenumber is True, nm if False)
  • step – Step size in nm
  • order – Folding order
  • fwhm_guess – Expected lines FWHM. Must be given in the unit of the cube (cm-1 if wavenumber is True, nm if False)
  • wavenumber – If True the cube is in wavenumber, else it is in wavelength.
  • calibration_coeff_map – Calibration coeff map (calibration laser map/ laser wavelength). Used to compute the line position in pixels.
  • calibration_laser_map – Calibration laser map (must always be the real one to compute the real fwhm)
  • nm_laser – Laser wavelength in nm.
  • poly_order – Order of the polynomial used to fit continuum.
  • filter_range – A tuple giving the min and max wavelength/wavenumber of the filter bandpass. Must be given in the unit of the cube (cm-1 if wavenumber is True, nm if False)
  • shift_guess – Velocity shift guess in km/s
  • fix_fwhm – (Optional) If True FWHM is fixed to fwhm_guess value (defautl False).
  • fmodel – (Optional) Type of line to fit. Can be ‘gaussian’ or ‘sinc’ (default ‘gaussian’).
  • subtract – (Optional) If not None this spectrum will be subtracted before fitting (must be a scipy.UnivariateSpline object).
  • cov_pos – (Optional) Lines positions in each spectrum are shifted with a covarying value.
  • cov_pos – (Optional) Lines sigma in each spectrum have a covarying value.
  • cov_fwhm – (Optional) FWHM is the same for all the lines in each spectrum.
  • binning – (Optional) On the fly data binning (default 1).
  • apodization – (Optional) Apodization level of the spectra. Line broadening due to apodization is removed from the fitting results (default None).
  • velocity_range – (Optional) A float setting the range of velocities in km/s where the lines can be found (e.g. for a galaxy, default None)
_get_calibration_coeff_map(calibration_laser_map_path, nm_laser, wavelength_calibration, axis_corr=1)¶

Return the calibration coeff map based on the calibration laser map and the laser wavelength.

Parameters:
  • calibration_laser_map_path – Path to the calibration laser map. If None, the returned calibration laser map will be a map full of ones.
  • nm_laser – calibration laser wavelength in nm.
  • wavelength_calibration – True if the cube is calibrated
  • axis_corr – (Optional) If the spectrum is calibrated in wavelength but not projected on the interferometer axis (angle 0) the axis correction coefficient must be given.
_get_calibration_laser_map(calibration_laser_map_path, nm_laser, wavelength_calibration, axis_corr=1)¶

Return the calibration laser map.

Parameters:
  • calibration_laser_map_path – Path to the calibration laser map. If None, the returned calibration laser map will be a map full of ones.
  • nm_laser – Laser wavelength in nm
  • wavelength_calibration – True if the cube is calibrated.
  • axis_corr – (Optional) If the spectrum is calibrated in wavelength but not projected on the interferometer axis (angle 0) the axis correction coefficient must be given.

  • region_name – Region name
_get_maps_list_path()¶

Return path to the list of extacted emission lines maps

extract_integrated_spectra(regions_file_path, lines, lines_velocity, lines_fwhm, filter_range, wavenumber, step, order, calibration_laser_map_path, wavelength_calibration, nm_laser, poly_order=0, sky_regions_file_path=None, cov_pos=True, cov_sigma=True, cov_fwhm=True, fix_fwhm=False, fmodel='gaussian', plot=True, auto_sky_extraction=False, sky_size_coeff=2.0, axis_corr=1.0, verbose=True, apodization=None, velocity_range=None)¶

Extract integrated spectra and their emission lines parameters.

All parameters of each emission line are mapped. So that for a gaussian fit with 4 parameters (height, amplitude, shift, fwhm) 4 maps are created for each fitted emission line in the cube.

Parameters:
  • regions_file_path – Path to a ds9 reg file giving the positions of the regions. Each region is considered as a different region.
  • lines – Lines rest frame. Must be given in the unit of the cube (cm-1 if wavenumber is True, nm if False)
  • lines_velocity – Mean Lines velocity in km.s-1.
  • lines_fwhm – Expected FWHM of the lines. Must be given in the unit of the cube (cm-1 if wavenumber is True, nm if False)
  • filter_range – A tuple giving the min and max wavelength/wavenumber of the filter bandpass. Must be given in the unit of the cube (cm-1 if wavenumber is True, nm if False)
  • wavenumber – If True the cube is in wavenumber else it is in wavelength.
  • step – Step size in nm
  • order – Folding order
  • calibration_laser_map_path – Path tot the calibration laser map
  • wavelength_calibration – True if the cube is calibrated.
  • nm_laser – Calibration laser wavelentg in nm.
  • poly_order – Order of the polynomial used to fit continuum.
  • fix_fwhm – If True fix FWHM to its guess (default False).
  • fmodel – (Optional) Type of line to fit. Can be ‘gaussian’ or ‘sinc’ (default ‘gaussian’).
  • cov_pos – (Optional) Lines positions in each spectrum are covarying.
  • cov_sigma – (Optional) Lines sigma in each spectrum are covarying.
  • cov_fwhm – (Optional) FWHM is the same for all the lines in each spectrum.
  • plot – (Optional) If True, plot each intergrated spectrum along with the its fit (default True).
  • auto_sky_extraction – (Optional) If True and if no sky region file path is given the sky is taken around the region and subtracted. The radius of the region around is controlled with sky_size_coeff. Note that this extraction only works for circular regions (default False).
  • sky_size_coeff – (Optional) Coefficient ofthe external radius of the sky region (default 2.).
  • axis_corr – (Optional) If the spectrum is calibrated in wavelength but not projected on the interferometer axis (angle 0) the axis correction coefficient must be given.
  • verbose – (Optional) If True print the fit results (default True).
  • apodization – (Optional) Apodization level of the spectra. Line broadening due to apodization is removed from the fitting results(default None).
  • velocity_range – (Optional) A float setting the range of velocities in km/s where the lines can be found (e.g. for a galaxy, default None)
Sky_regions_file_path:
 

(Optional) Path to a ds9 region file giving the pixels where the sky spectrum has to be extracted. This spectrum will be subtracted to the spectral cube before it is fitted (default None).
extract_lines_maps(object_regions_file_path, lines, lines_velocity, lines_fwhm, filter_range, wavenumber, step, order, calibration_laser_map_path, wavelength_calibration, nm_laser, poly_order=0, sky_regions_file_path=None, cov_pos=True, cov_sigma=True, cov_fwhm=True, fix_fwhm=False, fmodel='gaussian', axis_corr=1.0, binning=1, apodization=None, velocity_range=None)¶

Extract emission lines parameters maps from a fit.

All parameters of each emission line are mapped. So that for a gaussian fit with 4 parameters (height, amplitude, shift, fwhm) 4 maps are created for each fitted emission line in the cube.

Parameters:
  • object_regions_file_path – Path to a ds9 regions file decribing the regions to extract.
  • lines – Lines rest frame. Must be given in the unit of the cube (cm-1 if wavenumber is True, nm if False)
  • lines_velocity – Mean Lines velocity in km.s-1.
  • lines_fwhm – Expected FWHM of the lines. Must be given in the unit of the cube (cm-1 if wavenumber is True, nm if False)
  • filter_range – A tuple giving the min and max wavelength/wavenumber of the filter bandpass. Must be given in the unit of the cube (cm-1 if wavenumber is True, nm if False)
  • wavenumber – If True the cube is in wavenumber else it is in wavelength.
  • step – Step size in nm
  • order – Folding order
  • calibration_laser_map_path – Path tot the calibration laser map
  • wavelength_calibration – True if the cube is calibrated.
  • nm_laser – Calibration laser wavelentg in nm.
  • poly_order – (Optional) Order of the polynomial used to fit continuum (default 0).
  • fix_fwhm – If True fix FWHM to its guess (default False).
  • fmodel – (Optional) Type of line to fit. Can be ‘gaussian’ or ‘sinc’ (default ‘gaussian’).
  • cov_pos – (Optional) Lines positions in each spectrum are covarying.
  • cov_sigma – (Optional) Lines sigma in each spectrum are covarying.
  • cov_fwhm – (Optional) FWHM is the same for all the lines in each spectrum.
  • axis_corr – (Optional) If the spectrum is calibrated in wavelength but not projected on the interferometer axis (angle 0) the axis correction coefficient must be given.
  • apodization – (Optional) Apodization level of the spectra. Line broadening due to apodization is removed from the fitting results (default None).
  • velocity_range – (Optional) A float setting the range of velocities in km/s where the lines can be found (e.g. for a galaxy, default None)
Sky_regions_file_path:
 

(Optional) Path to a ds9 region file giving the pixels where the sky spectrum has to be extracted. This spectrum will be subtracted to the spectral cube before it is fitted (default None).
Binning:

(Optional) On the fly data binning (default 1).
extract_raw_lines_maps(lines, lines_velocity, lines_fwhm, step, order, wavenumber, calibration_laser_map_path=None, nm_laser=None, axis_corr=1.0)¶

Raw extraction of a portion of the spectral cube. Return the mean of the slice.

Parameters:
  • lines – Lines rest frame. Must be given in the unit of the cube (cm-1 if wavenumber is True, nm if False)
  • lines_velocity – Mean Lines velocity in km.s-1.
  • lines_fwhm – Expected FWHM of the lines. Must be given in the unit of the cube (cm-1 if wavenumber is True, nm if False)
  • step – Step size in nm
  • order – Folding order
  • wavenumber – If True the cube is in wavenumber else it is in wavelength.
  • calibration_laser_map_path – Path tot the calibration laser map
  • wavelength_calibration – True if the cube is calibrated.
  • nm_laser – Calibration laser wavelentg in nm.
  • axis_corr – (Optional) If the spectrum is calibrated in wavelength but not projected on the interferometer axis (angle 0) the axis correction coefficient must be given.
get_sky_radial_velocity(sky_regions_file_path, lines_fwhm, filter_range, wavenumber, step, order, calibration_laser_map_path, wavelength_calibration, nm_laser, poly_order=0, fix_fwhm=False, fmodel='gaussian', show=True, axis_corr=1.0)¶

Return the sky radial velocity.

Sky_regions_file_path:
 

Path to a ds9 region file giving the pixels where the sky spectrum has to be extracted.
Parameters:
  • lines_fwhm – Expected FWHM of the lines. Must be given in the unit of the cube (cm-1 if wavenumber is True, nm if False)
  • filter_range – A tuple giving the min and max wavelength/wavenumber of the filter bandpass. Must be given in the unit of the cube (cm-1 if wavenumber is True, nm if False)
  • wavenumber – If True the cube is in wavenumber else it is in wavelength.
  • step – Step size in nm
  • order – Folding order
  • calibration_laser_map_path – Path to the calibration laser map.
  • wavelength_calibration – True if the cube is calibrated.
  • nm_laser – Calibration laser wavelentgh.
  • poly_order – (Optional) Order of the polynomial used to fit continuum (default 0).
  • fix_fwhm – If True fix FWHM to its guess (default False).
  • fmodel – (Optional) Type of line to fit. Can be ‘gaussian’ or ‘sinc’ (default ‘gaussian’).
  • show – (Optional) If True, show the sky spectrum and the fitted function (default True).
  • axis_corr – (Optional) If the spectrum is calibrated in wavelength but not projected on the interferometer axis (angle 0) the axis correction coefficient must be given.

Note

Use orb.core.Lines to get the sky lines to fit.
